page.title: 11DOVER:FREIGHT TRAFFIC
page.content: Over 600,000 freight vehicles passed through the port of Dover in 1982 to justify Dover's claim to be Europe's leading Roll on-Roll off(Ro-Ro) port. Many facilities help freight drivers speed through the port.A large airport-style information system has been installed which displays the registration numbers of these vehicles cleared by customs. For driver's convenience there has been various points throughout the terminal. A post-tube system has also been installed which transports customs documentation in seconds from the freight agent to customs via one of the freight consortia. For driver's every comfort while waiting for HM Customs clearance.There are showers,television lounge,vending machines and a freight diner. Dover has the highest frequency of
